Comment: I am very glad to be Canadian these days. It seems to me that there is a basic failure in America where it comes to popular resistance. Wealth is worshipped in the US to such an extent that even when you are being oppressed by wealth you can’t effectively oppose it. Now it may have something to do with the absence of what used to be called the free press but I just don’t see resistance to Trumpism outside of whining on Reddit.
Author: Crowmakeswing

Comment: I don't like the French comparison.   - The French discuss politics all the time versus the US thinking it's not ever for polite conversation.   - We protest, but the French government has actually feared for its existence on multiple occasions during periods of public outcry.   - Also more than 1/3rd of the population lives in the Paris region—imagine 1/3rd of the US living in  NOVA/Maryland/DC where a protest could be less than 90 min away.
